description:
Sylvester - (Face Mask) - 1 page (untitled) (inside front cover)

Tweety and Sylvester - Tweety Tooth - 8 pages

Little Pancho Vanilla - Amigo's Surprise - 4 pages

Tweety and Sylvester - School Of Hard Knocks - 5 pages

Daffy Duck and Beaky Buzzard - Fair Weather Friend - 1 page text story

Sylvester - Whopperoo! - 1 page Word Puzzle

Tweety and Sylvester - Highflying Feline - 5 pages

Tweety and Sylvester - The Little Tin Soldier - 7 1/2 pages - feat. Porky Pig, Elmer Fudd

Monsanto ad (back cover)
name: Tweety Tooth

description:
Tweety and Sylvester - The Merry Canaries - 7 pages (reprinted as Tweety and Sylvester #1 - Tweety and Sylvester Western Publishing 1976)

Tweety and Sylvester - The Cat Takes The Cake - 6 pages

Bugs Bunny & Elmer Fudd - Tee Time Trouble - 1 page text story

Beep Beep The Road Runner - Birds Of A Feather - 4 pages

Tweety and Sylvester - The Foot Feat - 7 pages

Tweety and Sylvester - Alias A Puppy Dog - 6 pages

Tweety and Sylvester - A Good Deed Indeed - 1 page

Tweety and Sylvester - Seeing Stars - 1 page (inside back cover)
name: The Merry Canaries

description:
Captain Marvel! in Killer Bee and Son - 1 page Hostess Twinkies ad - Inside Front Cover

1) Tweety and Sylvester - I Dig It! - 6 pages

2) Tweety and Sylvester - Space Bird - 6 pages

3) Tweety and Sylvester - Sylvester The Tough - 5 pages

4) Tweety and Sylvester - Sleeping Beauty - 6 pages

Copyright 1977, by Warner Bros Inc.
name: I Dig It!

description:
The Corinthian is supposed to be a nightmare. He's not supposed to have bad dreams, but a strange link has formed between the toothily charming new Corinthian and Gabriel, a delusional victim of an older version of the Corinthian. Gabriel believes that he is truly the Corinthian, and his warped reality is affecting the Dreaming.

Former victim of Corinthian starts believing he is the Corinthian.
name: Souvenirs, Part One

description: On the trail of a mortal copycat killer, the new Corinthian discovers there are plenty of temptations for a nightmare in the waking world, and some unexpected dangers besides.
name: Souvenirs, Part Two

description:
The new Corinthian confronts his past in the form of his mortal counterpart, resulting in revelations for both.

Corinthian and Matthew meet Gabriel and Echo.
name: Souvenirs, Part Three

description: The shocking dreams of an outwardly prim young Victorian woman threaten to collide with her waking life in the form of a handsome, debauched, stranger--a stranger who bears an uncanny resemblance to a certain tooth-eyed gentleman from the Dreaming.
name: Tears for a Dark Rose - Book 1: The Unwalked Path

description:
The conclusion of the 2-part "The Dark Rose," written and drawn by Al Davison (The Spiral Cage, VERMILLION). The new Corinthian discovers a secret of his older self, and a lonely young woman finally meets her unlikely soul mate.

Notes:

-While the first part of this story was called "Tears for a Dark Rose", this second part is simply called "The Dark Rose"

-While Morpheus is in this issue, it is just a one-page non-speaking appearance.
name: The Dark Rose - Part Two: A Shadowed Heart

description: At first, Matthew the Raven thinks it's just a bad dream. It turns out to be an even worse awakening when a mysterious force yanks him out of Eve's cave and into the waking world, where he finds himself naked, shivering, and unmistakably human.
name: UN-kindness OF One: Part One

description: Eve leaves the safety of her cave in the Dreaming in order to look for Matthew in the waking world. Heedless of the consequences, Eve calls in a very old debt to aid her search, while Lucien the librarian makes an extremely personal sacrifice for the suddenly ravenless lady of nightmares.
name: UN-kindness OF One: Part Two

description: This unexpected chapter in Matthew's existence draws to a close as Matthew learns the real nature of his enemy, and Eve, the raven Lucien, and an avian army help combat it. But no battle is without its losses.
name: UN-kindness OF One: Part Three

description: The story of one of the Sandman's former ravens, Aristeas of Marmora. Like Matthew, Aristeas returned to the waking world as a man, only to find that there is a price to be paid for having your dreams come true.
name: My Year As A Man

description: When Cain discovers Abel's secret shrine to Goldie and begins to disrupt it, Abel raises his hand to him for the first time ever. Cain is stunned as he has never been struck before. He leaves the House of Secrets telling his brother that's going to be very sorry as he bears the Mark. Later that evening, Abel is visited by the wrath of Heaven. The angel/demon tells him he has raised his hand to Cain and must be punished. Cain actually does try to help Abel, but the creature simply teleports him into the swamp. The monstrous being tells Abel that for striking Cain, he gets one wish, but warns him that whatever he wishes for will not turn out well. Abel is smart enough to ask "Then suppose I don't wish for anything?" But his tormenter is having none of that and says that Abel already has. Goldie is returned to the House of Secrets.
name: Restitution

description: The House of Mystery has hated its caretaker for so long that no one even talks about it anymore. But even houses have their limits and the House of Mystery has decided that it just can't take it anymore.
name: Many Mansions, Part One: Stormy Weather

description:
As the House of Mystery goes up in smoke, Eve remembers a long-neglected figure still trapped in the attic of the burning house.

Dreamers involved with historical fires are called to burning House of Mystery.

Note: Death of the Endless only appears as dialogue in caption boxes.
name: Many Mansions, Part Two: Dreams The Burning Dream

description:
The House of Mystery lies in ashes, but the real destruction is just beginning for Cain, as he and a host of scorched mysteries must take refuge in Abel's House of Secrets.

With the House of Mystery burned to the ground, Cain and the few mysteries he was able to salvage are forced to move into the House of Secrets with his brother Abel. The laws of the realm prevent Merv Pumpkinhead from beginning work on rebuilding the Cain's home, and Cain falls deeper and deeper into a depression.
name: Many Mansions, Part Three: Ashes

description:
As the castle library is filled with salvaged treasures from the destruction of the House of Mystery, an overburdened Lucien finds himself near the breaking point as events force him to confront some mysteries from his own past.

Lucien begrudgingly allows Cain and his mysteries to move into his library but, when an argument between Cain and Merv causes damage to the books, Lucien casts them all out in a fit of rage. Lucien takes time alone to dream and reflect on his past and mistakes he feels he's made.
name: Many Mansions, Part Four: Temporary Overflow

description:
A special, extra-sized issue finds the House of Secrets materializing in the waking world on Halloween. For one night only, Abel has license to tell secrets without fear of retribution. His captive audience: five outcast goth kids who get more tricks than treats when confronted by an upset Cain.

On November Eve (or Halloween as most would call it), the rules state that Abel is allowed to reveal as many secrets as he likes without punishment until the stroke of midnight. And the House of Secrets takes in a group of trick-or-treaters in order to tell them the secret story of a freakshow. When the kids are unimpressed, Cain steps in to spin a tale of a mysterious illness that swept over a mining town. Lastly, Matthew the raven flies in and relates a story his days as a secret agent, back when he was Matt Cable.

The work on this extra-sized, 37 page issue was split between the series' two main writers and a handful of artists.

The framing story was written by Caitlin R. Kiernan and illustrated by Paul Lee and Kim DeMulder.

The three stories being told were written by Peter Hogan and illustrated by Shawn McManus (pg. 8-12), Scott Hampton (pg. 17-22), and Gary Amaro (pg. 28-33).
name: Many Mansions, Part Five: November Eve

description:
Amidst the rubble of war-torn London, fellow immortals Hob Gadling and Mad Hettie struggle with love, loss, and the search for hope during the 1940 Blitz.

Taking in May 1940, this story follows some familiar characters during the last days of the London Blitz.

Mad Hettie falls asleep in a burning building (where she dreams of the events of The Dreaming #28).

Hob Gaddling and his wife Peg (aka "Jim" from The Sandman #53) meet with their son who is on leave from the navy. Caught in a cellar during the bombings, Peg suffers a heart attack and dies shortly after,

Criminal Jack Constantine has been robbing bombed out science labs, but is ultimately caught by a persistent policeman.

Hettie and Hob, both immortals, console each other and vow to meet again for a date in Piccadilly when the war is over.
name: London Pride

description:
In a haunting stand-alone story set on the ocean floor, a young merwoman stands trial for speaking forbidden truths culled from her dreams - and discovers the key to her salvation in an item lost from the House of Mystery.

Note: Though it is actually the 6th installment of the Many Mansions storyline, this story is labelled as "Part Seven". The previous issue was a one-shot story that had nothing to do with the current storyline despite coming in the middle of it, and its likely that Kiernan or the editors mistakenly counted it as a chapter of the ongoing storyline.
name: Many Mansions, Part Seven: Dream Below

description: Tortured by his brother's pain, Abel pays Eve a visit to enlist her help in stopping Cain's descent into drunken despair.
name: Many Mansions, Part Eight: Ruin

description: In a one-shot bridge between story arcs, the poet W. B. Yeats finds himself inexplicably documenting an impressionistic dream in which Christina, the haunting woman from Lucien the librarian's past, appears.
name: Kaleidoscope

description:
Part 1 of the 3-part "The Gyres": The villainous Echo lies sick, crippled and helpless in a New Orleans squat - until she finds herself in the Dreaming about to unleash a disastrous chain of events.

Note: this issue continues events from The Girl Who Would Be Death.
name: The Gyres, Part One: Slow Dying

description: "The Gyres" part 2 of 3: Disoriented and stranded in The Dreaming, the villainous Echo latches onto "her" thirst for revenge - and heads for The Citadel of the Corinthian.
name: The Gyres, Part Two: Pariah

description: The conclusion of "The Gyres": After the Lord of Dreams himself denies The Corinthian vengeance against Echo, the nightmare decides to take justice into his own hands, as Echo leaves The Dreaming for a gruesome surprise in the waking world.
name: The Gyres, Part Three: Apostate

description:
A bold, self-contained issue designed to serve as a jumping-on point for new readers, "The Lost Language of Flowers" features a new look courtesy of cover artist Dave McKean and a lead story ilustrated by Shawn McManus (THE SANDMAN: A GAME OF YOU), with a framing sequence drawn by THE DREAMING's Christian Hjgaard and Teddy Kristiansen. A troubled teenager embarks on a surreal journey through The Dreaming to free her sister from the deadly grip of the Three Witches, encountering many of the fantastic inhabitants of the Dream King's realm along the way, including Eve, Lucien, Mervyn Pumpkinhead, and Goldie.

Essentially a surreal alternate take on Sandman's The Kindly Ones story arc. Neil Gaiman supplies a foreword on the inside front cover.
name: The Lost Language of Flowers

description: Part 1 of the 3-part "Foxes and Hounds," featuring the new regular art team of Christian Hjgaard and Ron Randall. Echo's death has not only granted him unpredictable access to both The Dreaming and the waking world, but has also resulted in his transformation from a male drug-abuser to a healthy, beautiful woman. But Echo has no time to revel in her newfound fortune since everyone, from the Corinthian, the most dangerous of all nightmares, to the Sandman's trusty librarian, is seeking revenge on the girl most likely to wreak havoc.
name: Fox and Hounds, Part One: New Orleans For Free

description:
Part 2 of the 3-part "Foxes and Hounds." The passion driving Lucien's misguided pursuit of Echo unfolds in "The Bittersweet Scent of Opium," a flashback issue set long ago in the Waking World. Lucien remembers his courting of the psychic medium Christina, whom Echo now eerily resembles. The ill-fated love affair holds the key to Lucien's obsession with Echo/Christina, and foreshadows an ominous ending for someone he holds dear...

Note: Epithumia, the "spirit" channeled by Christina Weston, is an alias of Desire.
name: Fox and Hounds, Part Two: The Bittersweet Scent of Opium

description: A beloved character with deep roots in VERTIGO faces a tragic end in the conclusion to "Foxes and Hounds." The day of reckoning arrives for hunted nightmare-on-the-run Echo, and even an envoy of the Endless may not be strong enough to stop The Corinithian and Matthew from exacting revenge. Will Lucien, still mired in his tragic obsession with Christina, catch up with everyone in time to stop the killing?
name: Fox and Hounds, Part Three: Detonation Boulevard

description:
Daniel, the Lord of Dreams, makes his first major appearance in THE DREAMING in the stunning coda to "Foxes and Hounds." As the denizens of the Dreaming show up to bid farewell to the friend who fell last issue, Daniel summons the Corinthian, Echo and Lucien to make them take responsibility for their actions. Meanwhile, a successor to the deceased waits in the wings.

Note: Death does not appear in person. Only her dialogue is seen by the reader.
name: Fox and Hounds Epilogue: The Two Trees

description:
A "glamour stone", enchanted by Morpheus and spurned by Nuala, becomes the catalyst for much intrigue in both an unsavory goblin court and in New York City, where the expatriate fairy wants desperately to pass for a regular human girl.

Note: For no apparent reason, this is the only chapter of the "Trinket" storyline with "Trinket, Part X" in the title.
name: Trinket, Part One: Homesick

description: The Cluracan's nemesis arrives in New York's Central Park to defend Nuala from an unsavory pack of fairies sent by the King of the Unseelie Court to steal her magical pendant. Unaware of the danger, a disenchanted Nuala prepares to reclaim her lost femme fatale allure at a Manhattan rave.
name: Masques & Hedgehogs

description: In "Mirror, Mirror," Victor continues his romantic pursuit of the elf girl Nuala, the Cluracan confronts his nemesis in a sword fight high over the streets of Manhattan, and the Unseelie court, still desperate to retrieve the glamour stone, moves in for the kill.
name: Mirror, Mirror

description: High above the city, the maniacal Unseelie faeries abduct Nuala while, in the middle of a Manhattan museum, Maddy uncovers the fantastic truth about the mysterious glamour stone in a special illustrated sequence by Charles Vess (NEIL GAIMAN & CHARLES VESS' STARDUST).
name: Trinket

description: Deep beneath the city streets, in the abandoned filth of underground New York, the Cluracan and his nemesis battle their way through the blood-thirsty hordes of the Unseelie Host in a desperate attempt to save their sister, Nuala. But are the combined forces of the Cluracan, his nemesis and Thessally strong enough to save Nuala from her own dark thirst for revenge?
name: Scary Monsters

description: The fate of a world rests in Maddy's hands as she aids Thessaly, Nuala and Lucien in a final confrontation with Titania, the High Queen of Faerie, for possession of the magically-charged Dawn Stone.
name: Shatter

description: Think rebuilding the House of Mystery is easy? Try finding its caretaker Cain - who uncovers a terrible secret and reveals a few of his own.
name: Restoration

description: Having survived a dangerous encounter with the Glamour Stone in The Dreaming, Maddy finds herself back in Manhattan...but things look very different. Now possessed of a magical "sight" that allows her to see simultaneously the world as we know it and the world as it really is, Maddy sees New York as a surreal landscape full of pitiful ghosts, beautiful ethereal fairies and terrifying monsters. Who says seeing is believing?
name: Second Sight

description: Having been banished from the Dreaming, The Corinthian indulges his most base appetites in the darkest corners of Bangkok. But he's not alone. A vicious serial killer stalks the very same mean streets, and the now-very-mortal Corinthian experiences how the other half dies when he becomes a killer's prey.
name: Exiles: Part One

description: Having been banished from the Dreaming, former serial killer The Corinthian finds himself swept up in a deadly game of international and interdimensional intrigue in Thailand in Part 2 of the 3-part "Exiles." But will the former-Dark-Mirror-turned-mortal fall prey to the forces of darkness or fall in love?
name: Exiles: Part Two

description: Concluding the 3-part "Exiles." In rain-soaked Bangkok, demonic forces vie against the now-mortal Corinthian in a desperate race to save his lover. To make matters worse, Echo arrives on the scene, intent on taking terrible vengeance on her favorite nemesis, the Corinthian himself.
name: Exiles: Part Three

description:
A special guest-filled issue of THE DREAMING features Lucien's precocious assistant, Danny Nod, as he travels different mythical realms with Goldie the Gargoyle. From the landing of Robin Hood's final, fateful arrow to the tantalizing harem of the Arabian Nights to Jack and the Beanstalk and the Three Little Pigs, Danny and Goldie partake in hilarious adventures as they interrupt stories in progress and change the course of modern literature in the process!

A story about Danny Nod off in The Dreaming collecting books that are overdue.

Collected in Sandman Presents: Taller Tales Trade Paperback

* Neil Gaiman consultant
name: The Further Adventures of Danny Nod  -Heroic Library Assistant-

description: "The First Adventure of Catterina Poe" is a self-contained story following the heroic exploits of Edgar Allen Poe's cat, who rescues her master from an early death, with help from Jessamy and Eve.
name: The First Adventure of Catterina Poe

description: Part 1 of the 4-part final story arc for The Dreaming, "Rise," a storyline which ignites a rebellion that will change forever the mercurial landscape that is The Dreaming. Following the Sandman's orders, the Corinthian returns to his citadel to resume his role as the Dark Mirror. But the Corinthian's treacherous nemesis, Echo, who has been running the show in his absence, has decided that she likes her current position and, ultimately, crafts a nightmare war in The Dreaming in an apocalyptic effort to retain the throne. Guest appearances by such favorite Sandman characters include Brute, Glob, Cain and Abel. With the conclusion of The Dreaming, readers may look forward to more stories featuring its denizens in upcoming projects of The Sandman Presents.
name: Rise, Part One: Bad Dreams

description: Part 2 of the 4-part "Rise," the final story arc for The Dreaming. Believing herself to be Dread, the twin of Dream, the bloodthirsty Echo continues unhindered in her misguided attempt to overthrow The Dreaming. With the aid of Brute and Glob, Echo leads an army of Nightmares in a gory rampage that ends at Eve's cave, where the mother of mankind must stand alone against the revolt. Daniel (the new Dream) waits on the sidelines in silence as the one chance to restore order appears to rest in the hands of Abel's always-unpredictable brother, Cain.
name: Rise, Part Two: Dominion

description: Part 3 of the 4-part "Rise," the final story arc of THE DREAMING. Echo continues her bloody assault on The Dreaming, leading an army of Nightmares to the gates of Lord Shaper's Palace. In the wake of the murder of his latest Raven, and with his kingdom in chaos, Daniel must make a fateful decision that will forever change the landscape of the Dreaming. Also guest-starring Cain, Abel, Brute, and Glob.
name: Rise, Part Three: The Prodigals

description: Final Issue. The conclusion of the 4-part "Rise." The series comes to an apocalyptic finish as Echo's relentless attempt to destroy Abel and Eve is thwarted. But it's Daniel's fateful decision, and the most shocking revelation of the series, that will forever haunt the mercurial landscape of the Dreaming.
name: Rise, Part Four: Awakenings
Talisman 2 Of 3
Talisman 3 Of 3 (Really!)

description: A force of men is assembled, so massive it shakes the earth with its march -- an army, vast beyond imagining, poised to devour tiny Greece, to snuff out the world's one hope for reason and justice. Only three hundred brave souls block its dash. But they are more than men . . . they are Spartans. The first full-color project by Frank Miller for Dark Horse, painted by Lynn Varley (Ronin, The Dark Knight Returns).
name: Honor

description: The word is out: Sparta is on the march. From farms and hamlets rally brave Greeks -- to face hellish war in the narrow mountain pass called The Hot Gates. The odds are long, and the stakes are high: All hope for human freedom hangs in the balance!
name: Duty

description: Dread Xerxes marshals all the armies of Asia against a tiny, plucky force of 300 Spartans -- and makes one last offer for peace. But peace means surrender. With stabbing spear and slashing sword, the Spartans respond. Their message is a simple one: These free men will not be slaves. There is no middle ground, no compromise to be had, between good and evil.
name: Glory

description: Combat. Grueling, hateful, joyous slaughter. The Spartans do what they were born and bred to do: they fight, brother beside brother, shoulder to shoulder, shield against shield, their bristling spears driving back the slaves of the tyrant Xerxes till the dead are piled high as a mountain and the sacred, rocky soil of Greece is drenched deep in Persian blood. Story and art by Frank Miller, painted color by Lynn Varley.
name: Combat

description: Betrayed, surrounded, outnumbered a hundred thousand to one, the Spartans make their last stand against the hordes of Xerxes. All hope is surely lost: only bloody death awaits them. Why, then, that wild, joyous light in the eyes of King Leonidas? What secret has he that makes him smile and speak so confidently of victory?
name: Victory

description: Continuing the story begun in the pages of Dark Horse Presents #34-#36, this is it--Dark Horse Comics' most ambitious project to date! The inhabitants of the colony planet Ryushi are peaceful ranchers--men and women who lead simple lives. But their lives are tragically shattered as they become part of a "coming of age" ceremony for that race of deadly alien hunters--the Predators. However, the Predators' prey are not the human inhabitants of Ryushi, but rather something far more dangerous--Aliens!

Overview

The quiet settlement on the planet Ryushi is turned into a battleground as the Predators clash with the vastly superior numbers of the Alien horde--with the few remaining humans caught in the middle fighting both sides! However, when it becomes apparent that the Aliens are winning, the humans and the Aliens are faced with a tough choice: trust each other--or die!

Overview

All hell breaks loose as the warring Predators begin their attack on the Alien brood- with the planet's inhabitants caught right in the middle! Machiko has a plan to roust all the invaders, but what can she do alone, with only a gun at her side?

Overview

Action is the key word for this final issue of comicdom's best-selling direct-sale comic book series! Machiko's only allies against the ever-increasing Alien horde are a lone Predator and a man on the brink of death!

name: A Tale of the Twentieth Century
An Exile in Japan
The Half-Aryan
Days of Infamy
1945 and All That Remains
